t: There*pn shall come forth a Rod from the stem of Jesse, And*ld a Branch shall grow out of his roots.
The*ld Spirit of the Lord*s shall rest upon Him, The*ld Spirit of wisdom and understanding, The*ld Spirit of counsel and might, The*ld Spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the Lord.*s
His*ln delight is*i in the fear of the Lord,*s And*ld He shall not judge by the sight of His eyes, Nor*ld decide by the hearing of His ears;

But*ld with righteousness He shall judge the poor, And*ld decide with equity for the meek of the earth; He*ld shall strike the earth with the rod of His mouth, And*ld with the breath of His lips He shall slay the wicked.
Righteousness*ld shall be the belt of His loins, And*ld faithfulness the belt of His waist.
“The*ln wolf also shall dwell with the lamb, The*ld leopard shall lie down with the young goat, The*ld calf and the young lion and the fatling together; And*ld a little child shall lead them.
The*ld cow and the bear shall graze; Their*ld young ones shall lie down together; And*ld the lion shall eat straw like the ox.
The*ld nursing child shall play by the cobra’s hole, And*ld the weaned child shall put his hand in the viper’s den.
They*ld shall not hurt nor destroy in all My holy mountain, For*ld the earth shall be full of the knowledge of the Lord*s As*ld the waters cover the sea.
“And*ln in that day there shall be a Root of Jesse, Who*ld shall stand as a banner to the people; For*ld the Gentiles shall seek Him, And*ld His resting place shall be glorious.”

It*ln shall come to pass in that day That*ild the Lord shall set His hand again the second time To*ld recover the remnant of His people who are left, From*ld Assyria and Egypt, From*ld Pathros and Cush, From*ld Elam and Shinar, From*ld Hamath and the islands of the sea.
He*ln will set up a banner for the nations, And*ld will assemble the outcasts of Israel, And*ld gather together the dispersed of Judah From*ld the four corners of the earth.
Also*ld the envy of Ephraim shall depart, And*ld the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off; Ephraim*ld shall not envy Judah, And*ld Judah shall not harass Ephraim.

But*ld they shall fly down upon the shoulder of the Philistines toward the west; Together*ld they shall plunder the people of the East; They*ld shall lay their hand on Edom and Moab; And*ld the people of Ammon shall obey them.

The*ld Lord*s will utterly destroy the tongue of the Sea of Egypt; With*ld His mighty wind He will shake His fist over the River, And*ld strike it in the seven streams, And*ld make men*i cross over dry-shod.
There*ld will be a highway for the remnant of His people Who*ld will be left from Assyria, As*ld it was for Israel In*ld the day that he came up from the land of Egypt.
